pattern.name: Emergency Modularization for Context Compliance
pattern.description: Rapid modularization of oversized files during validation crisis while preserving functionality
pattern.context: Validation failures returned after prompt system deployment, 4 files massively exceeded size limits
pattern.trigger: GitHub Actions validation emails resumed, compliance dropped from 99/100 to 64/100
pattern.root_cause: Enhanced prompt system files violated context optimization requirements without proactive monitoring

steps: Create crisis branch with descriptive naming
Split large files into focused single-responsibility modules
Preserve all functionality through backward compatibility redirects
Comprehensive PR with crisis analysis and community learning
Complete workflow execution through validation and merge
Final handoff update with resolution documentation

scripts/check-prompt-updates.sh.after: Core entry point + 3 utility modules ≤75 lines each

.github/workflows/upstream-prompt-sync.y.after: Core workflow + 3 composite actions ≤50 lines each

lessons_learned: Complete workflow execution is mandatory (not just PR creation)
Emergency modularization can enhance architecture while fixing compliance
Safety-first branch workflow works perfectly under pressure
Crisis response creates valuable community learning patterns

immediate: Proactive file size monitoring during development
Enhanced validation with warnings at 80% of limits
Regular architecture reviews for growing files
systematic: Pre-commit hooks for file size checking
Automated splitting suggestions for approaching limits
Community patterns for maintaining modular structure

community_value.applicability: any project with context optimization requirements
community_value.learning_value: demonstrates crisis response under real pressure
community_value.prevention_value: clear strategies to avoid similar crises

week_1: Enhance validation scripts with size warnings

new_requirements: Complete workflow execution mandatory for crisis resolution
Emergency fixes must include merge and final handoff
Crisis response procedures documented in standards

meta_achievement: Perfect self-compliance under pressure - demonstrated own standards effectiveness in real crisis conditions
